content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The structure consists of 7 building blocks arranged in 3 layers:
- Bottom layer: 2 red arch-shaped blocks
- Middle layer: 2 yellow rectangular blocks
- Top layer: 1 red arch-shaped block with an orange roof made of 2 triangular blocks

## Spatial Relationships
- Bottom layer: Two red arch blocks (with semi-circular cutouts) positioned side by side
- Middle layer: Two yellow rectangular blocks placed horizontally on top of the red arch blocks
- Top layer: A red arch block with a semi-circular cutout, placed on top of the yellow blocks
- Roof: Two orange triangular blocks forming a peaked roof on top of the red arch block

# Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on the target image, I need the following blocks:

1. Block #1 - Red arch block with semicircular cutout (left side of bottom layer)
2. Block #2 - Red arch block with semicircular cutout (right side of bottom layer)
3. Block #6 - Red arch block with semicircular cutout (top layer)
4. Block #8 - Yellow rectangular block (left side of middle layer)
5. Block #9 - Yellow rectangular block (right side of middle layer)
6. Block #14 - Orange triangular block (left side of roof)
7. Block #15 - Orange triangular block (right side of roof)

# Assembly Order

```
{
    Step1: Move block with index 1
    Step2: Move block with index 2
    Step3: Move block with index 8
    Step4: Move block with index 9
    Step5: Move block with index 6
    Step6: Move block with index 14
    Step7: Move block with index 15
}
```

The assembly proceeds from bottom to top, starting with the foundation arch blocks, then the yellow rectangular blocks for the middle layer, followed by the top red arch block, and finally the two orange triangular roof pieces.
